titleInfo.title: Narrow Endemic Plants Survey Areas, Riverside County California, 2019

mods.abstract: MSHCP Narrow Endemic Plant Species Survey Areas (NEPSSA)These survey areas were identified based on the presence of select soils, existing occurrence data for Narrow Endemic Plant Species (UC Riverside database and CNDDB), personal communication with the USFWS and Fred Roberts. Select soils were digitized from 1971 Soil Conservation Service Soil Survey (Knecht 1971). SPECIES OF CONCERN AREA ID:AREA 1: Allium munzii, Ambrosia pumila, Dodecahema leptoceras, Dudleya multicaulisAREA 2: Allium munzii, Ambrosia pumila, Dudleya multicaulis, Orcuttia californica, Trichocoronis wrightii var wrightiiAREA 3: Navarretia fossalis, Orcuttia californica, Trichocoronis wrightii var wrightiiAREA 3a: Navarretia fossalis, Orcuttia californica, Trichocoronis wrightii var wrightiiAREA 4: Allium munzii, Orcuttia californicaAREA 5: Dodecahema leptocerasAREA 6: Arabis johnstonii, Calochortus palmeri var. munzii, Galium angustifolium ssp. jacinticumAREA 7: Phacelia stelllarisAREA 8: Allium marviniiAREA 9: Dudleya multicaulis, Satureja chandleri, Sibaropsis hammittii
mods.note: Riverside County (Calif.). Geographic Information Services. (2019). Narrow Endemic Plants Survey Areas, Riverside County California, 2019. Riverside County (Calif.). Geographic Information Services. Available at: http://purl.stanford.edu/NarrowEndemicPlantsSurvey.shp

recordInfo.recordOrigin: This record was translated from ISO 19139 to MODS v.3 using an xsl transformation.
